parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Intermittent Failure of ABS Control Module
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The intermittent failure of the ABS control module can cause the ABS and traction control systems to malfunction, leading to unpredictable braking behavior, increased stopping distances, and a higher risk of accidents.
symptoms: ABS and traction control lights illuminate on the dashboard
intermittent loss of ABS and traction control functions
brakes may hesitate or fail to engage properly
rear wheel spin in slippery conditions
and sudden activation of ABS brakes under normal driving conditions.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the timing belt can cause the engine to shut off without warning, leading to loss of power, loss of hydraulic pressure, and potential accidents.
symptoms: The engine shuts off without warning
the pistons stop moving on one side
the pistons continue to move on the other side although the engine shuts off.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the air flow meter can cause the engine to lose power, leading to potential accidents.
The failure of the serpentine belt can cause the engine to shut off without warning, leading to loss of power, loss of hydraulic pressure, and potential accidents.
symptoms: the engine shuts off without warning

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The defect in the exhaust system can cause toxic fumes to enter the vehicle, leading to health issues for the occupants.
symptoms: A toxic sulfur dioxide smell comes from the exhaust
causing the consumer to become sick.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the drive shaft can cause unusual noises, vibrations, and potentially lead to loss of control, increasing the risk of accidents.
symptoms: such as scraping or dragging sounds
coming from the rear of the vehicle

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Transmission failure can cause the vehicle to lose power, stall, or become difficult to shift, leading to accidents or leaving the driver stranded.
A malfunctioning traction control system can cause the vehicle to lose traction, skid, or become difficult to control, increasing the risk of accidents.
